thread.title: Antonio Brown tweets negative scouting report from 2010 after signing huge extension
thread.title_full: Antonio Brown tweets negative scouting report from 2010 after signing huge extension

title: Antonio Brown tweets negative scouting report from 2010 after signing huge extension
text:
Feb 28, 2017 at 9:59a ET 0Shares 
Antonio Brown was made the NFL’s highest-paid wide receiver on Monday night when he inked a five-year extension with the Pittsburgh Steelers. It was a move that was a long time coming, considering how productive he’s been for the past four years. 
After signing the lucrative extension, Brown shared his scouting report from 2010, which he has kept ever since. Some highlights are “very thin,” “lacks functional strength,” and “concentration lapses.” 6th Round. 195th overall.
